laboratory_examinations.findings: Total serum calcium levels ranging from 2.68 –2.95 mmol/liter.
Normal intact PTH level of 40 pg/ml (normal, 10–65 pg/ml) when serum calcium was 2.95 mmol/liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Intact PTH levels were 66 pg/ml when serum calcium was 2.75 mmol/liter and 42 nl equivalents/ml when calcium was 2.95 mmol/liter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: First result was 1.43 mmol with a calcium to creatinine clearance ratio of 0.006; second result was 3.43 mmol with a ratio of 0.013.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased from 1.43 mmol to 3.43 mmol in two months.
Increased to 39 pg/ml in the postoperative measurement.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum calcium concentration decreased to 2.38 mmol/liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequently increased to 2.68 mmol/liter within a week.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 0.6 mmol with a creatinine clearance of 82 ml/min.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 2.63 mmol with a high calcium diet.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild osteopenia of the lumbar spine (T score, –1.05).

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Stable, with no significant changes noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: At the upper limit of normal at 149 pmol/liter.
